articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Koreans in Japan Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Koreans in Japan Delegation
 Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk with the congratulatory group of Koreans in Japan headed by Ri Ki Sok, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Wednesday.

articles.title: Hu Jintao Meets WPK Delegation
articles.content:
Hu Jintao Meets WPK Delegation
 Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- Hu Jintao, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China (CPC), met and had a friendly talk with the delegation of the International Affairs Department of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea led by Director Kim Yong Il on a visit to China at the Great Hall of the People in Beijing on Feb. 23.
					 The head of the delegation conveyed the regards of General Secretary Kim Jong Il to Hu Jintao.
					
					 Hu expressed deep thanks for this and asked the head of the delegation to convey his warm greetings and best wishes to Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He also extended heartfelt thanks to Kim Jong Il for personally receiving the delegation of the International Liaison Department of the C.C., the CPC during its recent visit to the DPRK.
					
					 Last year the two countries celebrated the 60th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties and successfully held functions to mark the "year of China-DPRK friendship", thus putting the traditional bilateral friendship on a new higher stage, he said, adding that this friendship is a precious treasure common to the two parties, countries and peoples and it is the steadfast policy of the Chinese party and government to boost this friendship.
					
					 Noting that he is sincerely rejoiced over the fact that the Korean comrades are speaking highly of the achievements made by China in its socialist modernization drive, he expressed the belief that the fraternal people of the DPRK would successfully carry out tasks set forth in the joint New Year editorial for this year marking the 65th birthday of the WPK and register fresh successes in building a thriving nation, achieving the independent and peaceful reunification of the country and developing foreign relations under the leadership of the WPK headed by General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Present there were members of the above-said delegation of the WPK, DPRK Ambassador to China Choe Jin Su, Head of the International Liaison Department of the C.C., the CPC Wang Jiarui and officials concerned. 
					
					 Kim Yong Il met and had a talk with Wang Jiarui on the same day.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Kuwaiti Emir
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Kuwaiti Emir
 Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Wednesday sent a message of greetings to Sheikh Sabah Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah, Emir of Kuwait, on the occasions of the 49th national day of Kuwait and the 19th anniversary of its liberation.
					 Kim in the message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger, sincerely wishing the emir and people of Kuwait greater successes in their work for the social stability and economic prosperity.

articles.title: Kim Yong Il Greets Kuwaiti PM
articles.content:
Kim Yong Il Greets Kuwaiti PM
 Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- Premier Kim Yong Il sent a message of greetings to Sheikh Nasser Al-Muhammad Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah, Prime Minister of Kuwait, on Wednesday on the occasions of the 49th national day of Kuwait and the 19th anniversary of its liberation. 
					 The message wished the prime minister greater success in his work for the social stability and economic progress of the country as well as good health and happiness.

articles.title: O Su Yong, Pak Ui Chun Meet Vietnamese Delegation
articles.content:
O Su Yong, Pak Ui Chun Meet Vietnamese Delegation
 Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- O Su Yong, vice-premier of the Cabinet, and Pak Ui Chun, foreign minister, separately conversed with a government economic delegation of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam headed by Bui Suan Khu, vice-minister of Industry and Commerce, who paid a courtesy call on them at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Wednesday.
					 Pak also met and had a talk with a delegation of the Foreign Ministry of Romania headed by Director General Gheorghe Magheru on the same day.

articles.title: Gift from Head of Vietnamese Delegation
articles.content:
Gift from Head of Vietnamese Delegation
 Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the head of a government economic delegation of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam on a visit to the DPRK.
					 The gift was conveyed to O Su Yong, vice-premier of the Cabinet, by Bui Suan Khu, vice-minister of Industry and Commerce of Vietnam who is heading the delegation, on Wednesday.

articles.title: Officials Watch Performance
articles.content:
Officials Watch Performance
 Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- The Song and Dance Ensemble of the Ministry of People's Security gave a performance at the Mansudae Art Theatre on Wednesday.
					 Among the audience were senior party and state officials, the chairperson of a friendly party, officials of ministries and national institutions and creators and artistes in the fields of culture and arts and officials guiding the creative work.
					
					 Artistes of the ensemble put on the stage chorus "Please Receive Our Salute", mixed duet and chorus "February Is Spring", female quartet and chorus "Our Country Is Witnessing Changes" and oungum ensemble "The General Star beyond the Clouds", female solo "Dear Comrade Leader's Good Health Is Our Happiness", guitar ensemble "Believe in Tomorrow" and chorus "Do Prosper, the Era of the Workers' Party" and other colorful numbers. 
					
					The performers enthusiastically sang of the undying feats General Secretary Kim Jong Il has performed by bringing about stirring realities in this land where the people's ideals come true thanks to his experienced and tested leadership.
					
					 They truthfully represented the pride of having reliably protected the gains of the revolution and the people's security as political defenders of the Workers' Party of Korea and their fixed will to firmly defend the best socialist system centered on the popular masses.

articles.title: Officials in Land and Environmental Conservation Meet
articles.content:
Officials in Land and Environmental Conservation Meet
 Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- A meeting of officials in the field of land and environmental conservation was held at the People's Palace of Culture Tuesday.
					 Present there were Premier Kim Yong Il, Secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea Choe Thae Bok, members of the Cabinet, officials of ministries, national institutions and working people's organizations, officials of party and power organs of provinces, cities and counties and those in the field of land and environmental conservation and relevant sectors.
					
					 Vice-Premier O Su Yong made a report at the meeting which was followed by speeches.
					
					 The reporter and speakers referred to the fact that the Party's policy on mobilization of the whole country for land management fully displayed its validity and vitality last year.
					
					 General Secretary Kim Jong Il clearly indicated the tasks and ways for improving and strengthening the work for land management while providing field guidance to the National Nursery of the Ministry of Land and Environmental Conservation, industrial establishments, cooperative farms and units of the Korean People's Army, they stressed.
					
					 They noted that all the people turned out in a dynamic drive to turn their native places and worksites into a socialist fairyland.
					
					 Hundreds of millions of trees of good species were planted and new roads were paved and technologically updated to more rationally form the road network across the country last year.
					
					 Projects for protecting dikes and river embankments and projects for repairing tide-water control dykes were carried out to create conditions for preventing flood damage and tidal wave damage and doing safer farming. And a turn was brought about in the work to spruce up streets and villages and increase the natural resources of the country.
					
					 The reporter and speakers stressed that the achievements made in last year's land management are the precious fruition of the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They underscored the need to dynamically push forward the work to add to the beautiful landscape of the country this year, true to the Party's plan for land development.

articles.title: Journalists Have Photo Session
articles.content:
Journalists Have Photo Session
 Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- The participants of the national meeting of journalists and other media persons had a photo session at the plaza of the Kumsusan Memorial Palace, the sacred temple of Juche, on Tuesday.
					 Present there were senior officials of the Party, the army and the state.

articles.title: Cuban Ambassador Hosts Reception
articles.content:
Cuban Ambassador Hosts Reception
Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- Jose Manuel Galego Montano, Cuban ambassador to the DPRK, hosted a reception at his embassy Tuesday on the occasion of the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 Present there on invitation were Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Pak Ui Chun, minister of Foreign Affairs, Ri Ryong Nam, minister of Foreign Trade, Kim Yong Jin, minister of Education, Kim Jong Suk, chairwoman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, Ri Yong Chol, vice department director of the WPK Central Committee, Pak Jae Gyong, vice-minister of the People's Armed Forces, and officials concerned.
					
					 On hand were staff members of the Cuban embassy.
					
					 Jose Manuel Galego Montano in his speech at the reception referred to the fact that Kim Jong Il has wisely led the Korean people in their endeavors for socialist construction and the reunification of the country. 
					
					 The fraternal friendly relations between Cuba and the DPRK provided by Fidel Castro Ruz and President Kim Il Sung have grown stronger under the deep care of Raul Castro Ruz and Kim Jong Il, he added. 
					
					 He expressed belief that the Korean people united close around Kim Jong Il would open the gate to a thriving nation in 2012.
					
					 Kim Ki Nam said in his speech that the birth of Kim Jong Il as the son of guerillas was a great auspicious event as it promised a rosy future of the country and the Korean revolution.
					
					 Noting that this year marks the golden jubilee of the opening of diplomatic ties between the DPRK and Cuba, he stressed that the DPRK would develop the friendly and cooperative relations between the two parties, governments and peoples in the future, too.
					
					 He hoped that the fraternal Cuban people would achieve greater successes in their efforts for defending their country and revolution, united close around the Communist Party of Cuba.

articles.title: Gifts from Chinese Figures
articles.content:
Gifts from Chinese Figures
 Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by Jin Xiaofei, director of the Beijing Association for International Friendly Contact in China, on the occasion of his birthday.
					 He conveyed the gift to the DPRK ambassador to China.
					
					 The managing director of a Chinese group corporation also presented Kim Jong Il with a gift.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birthday Celebrated at DPRK Missions
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birthday Celebrated at DPRK Missions
Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- Receptions, friendly gatherings, book and photo exhibitions and film shows were held at the DPRK embassies in Havana, Vientiane, Dhaka, Phnom Penh, Katmandu, Kuwait City, Singapore, Rome, Berlin, Prague, Bucharest, Sofia, Stockholm, Cairo, Addis Ababa and Brasilia and at the consulates general in Shenyang and Nakhodka from Feb. 5 to 15 on the occasion of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's birthday. 
					Displayed in the venues of events were works of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and photos on the immortal feats performed by them and books and photos showing the advantages and invincible might of Korean-style socialism centered on the popular masses.
					
					Present there on invitation were personages of various strata and others and officials of the DPRK missions in the relevant countries. 
					
					Speeches were made at the events.
					
					The joint general secretary of the Central Committee of the Awami League of Bangladesh praised Kim Jong Il as an outstanding leader who has wisely led the overall work of the Party, state and army, reinforcing the DPRK as an invulnerable fortress of socialism.
					
					The advisor to the prime minister of Cambodia said: 
					
					The DPRK is not a big country but no big powers dare provoke it because Kim Il Sung and
						 Kim Jong Il thoroughly adhered to the Songun idea and line. The DPRK successfully launched satellites and conducted underground nuclear tests entirely by its own efforts and with its own technology, a clear proof of its tremendous national power.
					
					The general secretary of the Movement for Peace and Socialism of Italy stressed that the Korean people are sure to build a thriving nation in the near future as long as they are guided by Kim Jong Il. 
					
					The participants of the film shows watched Korean films such as "Fireworks for a Thriving Nation" and "The Tower of the Juche Idea."

articles.title: Modernization Moves Ahead in Light Industry
articles.content:
Modernization Moves Ahead in Light Industry
 Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- Light industry factories and enterprises of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea have directed efforts to updating production processes, developing new products and boosting output.
					 The Pyongyang Textile Mill has introduced an integrated computer-controlled system in the combined dyeing and silk-spinning shops and added to the variety of cloth. The Kusong and other textile mills across the country have sharply increased the production of suit materials and towels.
					
					 The Songyo Knitted Goods Factory, the Pyongyang Children's Knitted Goods Factory and the Pyongyang Socks Factory are furnished with modern equipment to mass-produce underclothes, shirts, socks and other knitwear of various models and colors.
					
					 An annual capacity of pressing several million pairs of soles has newly been created and production processes have been streamlined at footwear factories to diversify the type and sort of footwear and raise their output.
					
					 The Pyongyang Textile Machine Factory has made a new kind of cog belt electromotive flexible loom while the Sinuiju Spinning Machine Factory has applied the CNC technology to profiler.
					
					 Combined foodstuff factories have been built on a modern basis in each province to produce foodstuffs including tasty and nutritive confectionary with raw materials available in their areas.
					
					 The Sinuiju Cosmetics Factory has built a soap powder production process and the Tobacco Complex has converted the conic gear cutting machine into a CNC multi-functional machine.

articles.title: Intelligent Gauges Developed
articles.content:
Intelligent Gauges Developed
 Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- Up-to-date gauges have been developed and applied to economic sectors of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 One of them is a modified version of differential flowmeter.
					
					 The device is designed to simultaneously measure, monitor and regulate pressure. 
					
					  It, developed by scientists of the Electronic Institute under the State Academy of Sciences, is also available in measuring every description of levels and pressure. It has already been used in metal, chemical, electricity, foodstuff and pharmaceutical industries.

articles.title: Guidelines for Creation of Musical Works
articles.content:
Guidelines for Creation of Musical Works
 Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il issued a famous work "Let Us Compose Revolutionary Musical Pieces Which People Love to Sing" on February 25, Juche 79 (1990).
					 In the work, he underscores the need to create revolutionary songs inspiring the people to do their best in socialist construction as well as emotional songs reflecting diversified aspects of their life.
					
					 Noting that musical pieces conducive to educating the people in a revolutionary manner such as those about the Party, fatherland, socialist system, revolutionary traditions and national reunification should be created in large number, he clearly indicates ways for this purpose.
					
					 Since the work was published, many songs reflecting the spirit of the times have come out to further develop Juche-based musical art.
					
					 "Leader Is Eternal Sun of People", "Our Leader Will Always Be with Us" and "When We Walk along the Road between Fields" represent well all the Korean people's reverence for President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 "Our Comrade Kim Jong Il", "Thunder over Jong Il Peak", "General's Inspection Tour of the Front" and "Let Us Hold High the Red Flag" sing of Kim Jong Il's strong will to defend the red flag and pursue Songun politics.
					
					 Meanwhile, songs reflecting labor and sentiments of the people and those suitable to the era of Songun have also been created.
					
					 The songs are now encouraging the Korean army and people in the effort for the building of a thriving nation.

articles.title: Media Persons Called upon to Become Buglers
articles.content:
Media Persons Called upon to Become Buglers
Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Wednesday editorially calls upon the journalists and other media persons to become vanguard on the ideological front and first-line buglers in the drive for devotedly defending General Secretary Kim Jong Il and achieving the prosperity of the socialist country.
					 The editorial goes on:
					
					 Kim Jong Il's message to the participants of the meeting titled "Journalists and Other Media Persons Are Buglers Sounding Advance in Dynamic Drive for Building a Great Prosperous and Powerful Nation" serves as a great programme to be upheld by the media in the DPRK in the era of a great surge as it indicates the way for remarkably augmenting the might of Juche-oriented media and a great banner encouraging the journalists and other media persons in their efforts to perform their missions and tasks as buglers taking the lead in the on-going general advance.
					
					 The recent meeting clearly proved that thanks to the tireless efforts and wise leadership of Kim Jong Il the media in the DPRK serve as a powerful weapon for the Songun revolution as they steer the era and give full play to the inexhaustible ideological and moral power of Kim Il Sung's nation. 
					
					 It is the great honor of the Party and people of the DPRK to have the journalists and other media persons glorifying the socialist homeland as an invincible great prosperous power, united close around the leader without the slightest vacillation in any storm.
					
					 All the people are turning out as one in the general charge for winning a final victory at a time when the advance for a great surge is witnessing a fresh phase under the Party's leadership. This stirring reality calls for giving fullest play to the mobilizing role of the media. 
					
					 The meeting provided an occasion in improving the work of the media in the DPRK as intended by the Party and as required by the Songun era of a great surge and ushering in a fresh heyday of Juche-based media and activities. 
					
					 The editorial calls on the journalists and other media persons to make a more dynamic drive for effecting a fresh turn in the media and publication and bringing earlier the final victory of building a thriving nation by tightly wielding pens of the revolution under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Reunification by Federal Formula Called for
articles.content:
Reunification by Federal Formula Called for
 Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- The best way of realizing the reunification of Korea in a reasonable manner is to found a unified state of the nation by federal formula based on one nation and state and two systems and governments.
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday observes this in a signed article.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The proposal for achieving reunification by federal formula is the peace-loving way for reunification which is conducive to guaranteeing global peace and security as well as ensuring durable peace on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 This proposal is the just and fair way for reunification as it neither ensures the predominance and interests of either the north or the south nor does harm to any side.
					
					 Huge armed forces of the north and the south of Korea are standing in acute confrontation along the Military Demarcation Line, leaving the peninsula fraught with the danger of war all the time. Under such situation, it is as plain as pikestaff that any try for "unification of systems", not reunification by federal formula would give rise to another war.
					
					 There is no reason for the north and the south of Korea to fight against each other as they are one nation. They should choose the reunification based on federation which would make it possible to reunify the country in a peaceful way, not a war which would bring ruin to the whole nation.
					
					 The proposal for achieving reunification based on federation is the only way of reunification for the Korean nation.
					
					 All the Koreans in the north and the south and overseas should turn out as one this year which marks the 30th anniversary of the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo and more dynamically conduct the patriotic struggle to realize the proposal for achieving reunification based on federation and thus bring about a decisive turn in the struggle to achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country.

articles.title: S. Korea's Redispatch to Afghanistan Blasted
articles.content:
S. Korea's Redispatch to Afghanistan Blasted
 Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- The Joint Conference of Civic and Public Organizations against the Move for Troop Re-dispatch to Afghanistan in south Korea had a rally in Seoul on Feb. 20 at which it urged the authorities to cancel their move for the re-dispatch of troops to the shambles of the U.S. war for aggression.
					 Speakers at the rally accused the present "government" of working hard to railroad the "motion calling for re-dispatch of troops to Afghanistan" through the session of the "National Assembly" at any cost, breaking its promise made to the people that it would not dispatch troops to Afghanistan again. 
					
					 Deploring that the dispatch of south Korean troops to the wars of aggression started by the U.S. in Iraq and Afghanistan caused heavy losses to innocent south Koreans, they lashed out at the authorities for contemplating the re-dispatch of troops, utterly indifferent to the lives and security of the people.
					
					 They demanded the "government" and the NA to immediately roll back the plan for the re-dispatch of troops under the pretext of "reconstruction."

articles.title: Solidarity Actions against Dictatorial Forces Called for
articles.content:
Solidarity Actions against Dictatorial Forces Called for
 Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- Civic and public organizations and opposition parties in south Korea held an anti-"government" rally in Seoul on Feb. 20 at which they called for intensifying solidarity actions for eliminating the puppet clique.
					 Speakers at the rally charged that the present regime not only brought the people's livelihood and economy to bankruptcy but is busy violating democracy as evidenced by its suppression of opposition parties, media persons and workers.
					
					 What is this, if not dictatorship, they queried, stating that nothing can be expected from the present "government" as it is hell-bent on high-handed and arbitrary practices, not afraid of the people.
					
					 They called for surely judging the dictatorial forces in the "election to local self-governing bodies" by carrying forward the fighting spirit of those who laid down their lives in the movement for independence, democracy and reunification this year marking the 10th anniversary of the publication of the June 15 joint declaration, the 50th anniversary of the April 19 Uprising and the 30th anniversary of the May 18 Kwangju Resistance. 
					
					 The only way for the people to win a victory is to achieve solidarity and alliance in progressive camp, they noted, calling upon all the progressive forces to get united and fight to the last.

articles.title: DPRK FM Statement Supported in Sweden
articles.content:
DPRK FM Statement Supported in Sweden
 Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- The Communist Party of Sweden made public a statement on Feb. 15 in support of the statement issued by the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK.
					 The statement said:
					
					 Unstable situation is prevailing on the Korean Peninsula as a peace treaty has not yet been concluded though nearly six decades have passed since the ceasefire in Korea.
					
					 The DPRK has made ceaseless efforts to seek a peaceful settlement of the nuclear issue on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 Noting that confidence building between the DPRK and the United States would create conditions for achieving peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula, the statement held that to this end it is necessary to conclude a peace treaty, to begin with. 
					
					 Supporting the DPRK's proposal for an early start of the talks for replacing the Armistice Agreement with a peace treaty, the statement called upon all the peace-loving forces in Sweden to make a contribution to lasting peace on the peninsula.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birthday Observed by Koreans in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birthday Observed by Koreans in Russia
Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- A meeting was held by Koreans in Russia at the DPRK embassy in Moscow on Feb. 20 in celebration of the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 Present there were Choe Pong Gil, chairman of the United Confederation of Koreans in Russia, Sok Song, first vice-chairman of the confederation, and other officials and compatriots.
					
					 On hand were the DPRK ambassador to Russia and his embassy officials.
					
					 Prior to the meeting, the participants placed a floral basket and bunches of flowers before the full-length painting of President     Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and paid tribute to them.
					
					 The speakers said at the meeting that the birthday of Kim Jong Il is a significant common holiday of not only the people in the homeland but the Koreans overseas and the world progressives.
					
					 They vowed to follow him, holding him in high esteem as the lodestar of Korea's reunification, and strive to glorify this year marking the 10th anniversary of the publication of the June 15 joint declaration as a year which will witness a fresh phase in the movement for independent reunification.
					
					 At the end of the meeting, the participants looked round works of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and photos on the heroic struggle of the Korean people displayed in the embassy.
					
					 Then followed a reception and an art performance.
					
					 They also watched the Korean film introducing scenic spots which turned into wonderful recreation centers for the people in the era of Songun.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birthday Celebrated in Different Countries
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birthday Celebrated in Different Countries
 Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- A joint seminar and a photo exhibition were held in UK and seminars in Bangladesh and France on Feb. 12 and 13 on the occasion of the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 Displayed in the venues of the exhibition were photos on the Songun leadership feats performed by President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and other photos on the Korean people's drive for building a thriving nation. 
					
					 Keith Bennet, deputy director-general of the European Society for the Study of the Juche Idea, Andy Brooks, general secretary of the Central Committee of the New Communist Party of Britain, and Dermot Hudson, chairman of the British Association for the Study of Songun Policy, said that under the leadership of Kim Jong Il the Korean people have made world-startling successes such as the successful launch of satellite Kwangmyongsong-2 and the carrying out of the second underground nuclear test despite the vicious anti-DPRK moves of the imperialist allied forces, etc. 
					
					 Chairman M. Gamrul Huda and an advisor to the Bangladesh Institute of the Juche Idea noted that the birthday of Kim Jong Il, the great sun of the 21st century, is a common holiday of not only the Korean people but the world progressives, adding that he has protected the dignity and sovereignty of the DPRK and steered the anti-imperialist struggle to victory despite the threat of the imperialists.  
					
					 Jean Marie Lambret, chief of the French Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Idea, said that the cause of building a thriving nation in the DPRK is sure to triumph thanks to the leadership of Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 A letter to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the event held in UK.
					
					 G. Debarajan, secretary of the Central Committee of the All-India Forward Bloc, and Hari Singh Khan, member of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of India (Marxist), each issued a statement on the occasion of the day.

articles.title: Story of Kim Jong Suk
articles.content:
Story of Kim Jong Suk
Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- One day in March Juche 24 (1935) anti-Japanese heroine
					 Kim Jong Suk had a discussion with an official of the people's revolutionary government in a guerrilla zone over the issue of moving its people to Chechangzi of Antu County. But their discussion was interrupted by an old woman.
					 The visitor asked the official why she could not go to Chechangzi along with other people, saying that she would never go to an enemy-controlled area even though she would die for the revolution.
					
					 Finding no word to persuade her, the official said he just obeyed his superior's direction.
					
					 Listening to their conversation, the heroine told him she would take the old woman with her, saying the revolutionary government should take care of her as she sent her only son to the anti-Japanese guerrilla army.
					
					 But the official was much surprised by her suggestion, afraid that she was the mother of a Minsaengdan (spy organization formed by the Japanese imperialists) suspect. 
					
					 Kim Jong Suk asked him why her son was suspected of being a member of Minsaengdan and scolded him for blindly following the instructions of those attempting to eliminate the backbone and hardcore members of the Korean revolution.
					
					 She continued to say that the revolutionary government should accept and implement only instructions given by General Kim Il Sung and take all who wanted to follow the general to Chechangzi, irrespective of their being Minsaengdan suspects or not.
					
					 As a result those whom national chauvinists and factionalists infected with flunkeyism intended to abandon were allowed to join other people moving to the new guerrilla zone.

articles.title: Hu Jintao se reune con delegacion del PTC
articles.content:
Hu Jintao se reune con delegacion del PTC
Pyongyang, 24 de febrero (ATCC) -- El secretario general del Comite Central del Partido Comunista de China, Hu Jintao, se reunio el dia 23 en el Gran Palacio del Pueblo de Beijing con la delegacion del Departamento Internacional del CC del Partido del Trabajo de Corea presidida por su jefe Kim Yong Il, de visita en China, y departio con sus integrantes en un ambiente amistoso.
					En la ocasion, el jefe de la delegacion coreana transmitio a Hu Jintao el saludo de parte del Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					
					Tras expresar profundo agradecimiento, Hu Jintao pidio a Kim Yong Il que trasladara al Dirigente su cordial saludo y sinceros votos.
					
					Dijo que agradece con todo corazon al Secretario General Kim Jong Il por haber recibido a la delegacion del Departamento de Enlace Internacional del CC del PCCh que visito recientemente a Corea.
					
					El ano pasado, ambos paises conmemoraron el aniversario 60 del establecimiento de las relaciones diplomaticas y desarrollaron en un nivel mas alto la tradicional amistad China-Corea mediante la celebracion exitosa de las actividades dedicadas al "Ano de amistad China-Corea", destaco el mandatario chino y prosiguio que esa amistad es el valioso patrimonio comun de los dos partidos, los dos paises y los dos pueblos, y el partido y el gobierno chinos se mantienen en su invariable orientacion de consolidarla.
					
					Estamos sinceramente contentos de que los camaradas coreanos apreciaran altamente los exitos alcanzados en la construccion para la modernizacion del socialismo de China, destaco.
					
					Expreso la conviccion de que bajo la direccion del PTC encabezado por el Secretario General
						 Kim Jong Il, el hermano pueblo coreano cumplira exitosamente en este ano del aniversario 65 de la fundacion del PTC las tareas presentadas en el editorial conjunto del ano nuevo y alcanzara asi nuevos logros en la construccion de la gran potencia prospera, la realizacion de la reunificacion independiente y pacifica del pais y las relaciones exteriores.
					
					En la ocasion estuvieron presentes los miembros de la delegacion coreana y el embajador de la RPDC en China, Choe Jin Su, por la parte coreana, y por la china, el jefe del Departamento de Enlace Internacional del CC del PCCh, Wang Jiarui, y otros funcionarios.
					
					El mismo dia, Kim Yong Il departio con su homologo chino.

articles.title: Cuadros presencian funcion de Conjunto Artistico de MINSEP
articles.content:
Cuadros presencian funcion de Conjunto Artistico de MINSEP
Pyongyang, 24 de febrero (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 24 en el Teatro de Arte Mansudae la funcion del Conjunto Artistico del Ministerio de Seguridad del Pueblo (MINSEP).
					La presenciaron los cuadros del Estado y el Partido del Trabajo de Corea, el presidente de un partido amigo, los funcionarios de los ministerios y organos centrales, los creadores, artistas y funcionarios directivos de la creacion del sector de cultura y arte. 
					
					Los artistas del conjunto artistico pusieron en la escena el coro "Que reciba saludo", el duo mixto y coro "Febrero es primavera", el cuarteto femenino y coro "Mi pais donde se realizan los ideales del pueblo", la cancion acompanada de Oungum "Al Lucero General, mas alla de las nubes", el solo femenino "La salud del querido camarada Dirigente es nuestra felicidad", la cancion acompanada de guitarra "Confiad en el manana", el coro "!Que prospere la epoca del Partido del Trabajo!", y otras piezas.
					
					Los ejecutantes alabaron con fervor las imborrables hazanas del Dirigente Kim Jong Il quien con la veterana y probada direccion abrio una realidad extraordinaria en que se realizan sobre la tierra patria los ideales del pueblo.
					
					Ademas, demostraron bien el orgullo de que crecidos firmemente como defensores politicos del Partido defendieron fidedignamente las conquistas de la revolucion y la tranquilidad del pueblo, y la ferrea voluntad de defender firmemente el mas ventajoso regimen socialista centrado en las masas populares.

articles.title: Conferencia de funcionarios de rama de proteccion territorial y ambiental
articles.content:
Conferencia de funcionarios de rama de proteccion territorial y ambiental
Pyongyang, 24 de febrero (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 23 en el capitalino Palacio Cultural del Pueblo la conferencia de los funcionarios de la rama de proteccion territorial y ambiental.
					Asistieron al acto el primer ministro del Consejo de Ministros de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea Kim Yong Il, el secretario del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea Choe Thae Bok, los miembros del Consejo de Ministros, los funcionarios de los ministerios, organos centrales y organizaciones de masas, las instituciones del partido y el poder de las provincias, ciudades y distritos, la rama de proteccion territorial y ambiental y otras relacionadas.
					
					El informe estuvo a cargo del vicepremier O Su Yong y otros intervinieron.
					
					Los oradores senalaron que en el ano pasado, se pusieron de pleno manifiesto la justeza y la vitalidad de la orientacion del partido en materia de la movilizacion general para la administracion territorial.
					
					El Dirigente Kim Jong Il dirigio sobre el terreno la Almaciga Central del Ministerio de Proteccion Territorial y Ambiental, las fabricas, empresas, granjas cooperativas y unidades del Ejercito Popular de Corea, donde ilumino claramente las tareas y medios para mejorar e intensificar la labor de administracion territorial, subrayaron los oradores.
					
					Se refirieron a que todo el pueblo se levanto como un solo hombre en la lucha por acondicionar su tierra natal y lugar de trabajo como paraiso socialista.
					
					En el ambito nacional, en el ano pasado se trasplantaron cientos de millones de arboles de buena variedad y se construyeron nuevas carreteras y se reconstruyeron estas en lo tecnico a fin de formar mas racionalmente la red de vias del pais.
					
					Se realizaron las obras de dique de los rios y proteccion de la costa y la reparacion de rompeolas, gracias a lo cual se prepararon las condiciones para prevenir los danos de la inundacion y marejada y cultivar seguramente la tierra, mientras tanto se registraron cambios en arreglar hermosamente las calles y aldeas y aumentar los recursos del pais, dijeron.
					
					Destacaron que los exitos alcanzados en la administracion territorial del ano despedido se deben a la sabia direccion del Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					
					Exhortaron a desarrollar energicamente en el ano en curso las labores para acondicionar bien la tierra patria en pleno acato al proposito del partido sobre la obra de la geotransformacion nacional.

articles.title: Periodistas deben ser trompeteros de la marcha general
articles.content:
Periodistas deben ser trompeteros de la marcha general
Pyongyang, 24 de febrero (ATCC) -- Los periodistas y otros hombres de prensa deben ser vanguardistas ideológicos y primeros trompeteros en la lucha por defender a costa de la vida al Dirigente Kim Jong Il y lograr la prosperidad de la patria socialista. 
					Señala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un editorial difundido este miércoles y continúa:
					
					El mensaje histórico del Dirigente "Los periodistas y los hombres de prensa son trompeteros de marcha en la batalla por la construcción de la gran potencia próspera", enviado a los participantes en la conferencia nacional de periodistas y hombres de prensa, es el gran programa de prensa de la época de gran auge que ilumina el camino para elevar extraordinariamente el poderío de la prensa de tipo jucheano, y sirve de la gran bandera para estimularlos a la lucha por cumplir satisfactoriamente con su misión y deber en la marcha general de hoy. 
					
					El presente conclave manifestó orgullosamente que gracias a la incansable abnegación y la sabia dirección del Dirigente, las publicaciones de nuestro país sirven de un arma poderosa de la revolución del Songun que conduce al frente la época y erupciona fuertemente la indoblegable potencia espiritual de la nación de Kim Il Sung.
					
					El gran orgullo de nuestro partido y pueblo es que tienen la fila de los periodistas y hombres de prensa, que, unidos compactamente en torno al Dirigente sin vacilación alguna ante todas las adversidades, glorifican la patria socialista como la invencible potencia próspera.
					
					Bajo la orientación del partido, nuestra marcha en gran auge acoge una nueva coyuntura y todo el pueblo se levanta como un solo hombre en la ofensiva general para lograr el triunfo final. Tal realidad demanda poner de pleno manifiesto el poderío movilizador de las publicaciones. 
					
					Con motivo del presente conclave, la labor de prensa e información se ha mejorado más de acuerdo con el propósito del partido y la demanda de la época de gran auge del Songun y se ha abierto una nueva era de prosperidad en la construcción y las actividades de las publicaciones de tipo jucheano. 
					
					Los periodistas y los hombres de prensa deben registrar un nuevo cambio en sus actividades manteniendo firmemente la pluma de la revolución bajo la dirección del Songun del Dirigente y luchar con más vigor por adelantar el triunfo final de la construcción de la gran potencia próspera.
